comments.author: Fionna the Human Girl

comments.text:
For me, the worst part of drawing is that i just don't like it anymore. :/ 
I only really draw when a certain mood strikes me. Whenever it does I get 
about half way through a drawing, and then I hate and it just bums me out. 
So I just kind of stopped.﻿
comments.author: Alsandr

comments.text:
What annoys me is some of the guys in my class will, whenever they see me 
drawing, (which is often because my classes are boring) they'll be all, 
"Bro, move your hand! MOVE YOUR HAND!" And I'll move my hand, hoping they 
might somehow have a constructive comment about it, but then they'll just 
say "Cool." And go back to whatever they were doing. Not that I mind too 
much, but still, the least you could do is make SOME semblance of a helpful 
remark -_-﻿
comments.author: YatzSliversword

TEH SKETCHBOOK!!! >:D﻿

comments.author: Miss Neko

comments.text:
why with anime style... like, "doodle". doodle is actually scratching pen 
and do random drawing but why people call those detailed art "doodle"? If 
people said "i draw doodle" then why can't we say "i draw anime"? i'm just 
thinking why anime style can't get perspective as equal as doodle, cartoon, 
and realism... it's also art, you know... i know anime means "animated 
japanese cartoon" or manga style is "japanese comic" but then, what should 
we call our art style? "japanese cartoon style"? that doesn't... sounds 
*right*... :(﻿

comments.text:
I am really jealous of that friend of mine, cause she copies drawings so 
fucking perfectly! When I bought Copic markers a few months ago, I made a 
lot of shit with them. Then, my friend comes to my house, uses my expensive 
Staldtler pens, my expensive Copic markers and… IN THE FIRST TIME SHE 
COLORS IT BETTER THAN ME. I GOT ANGRY IN SO MANY FUCKING WAYS, FOR SO MANY 
FUCKING REASONS!! 
AND SHE ALWAYS ASKS ME TO DRAW SOMETHING FOR HER, LIKE A HEAD, OR EYES, AND 
I GET REALLY PISSED OFF. 
But I won't ever tell her, of course… ﻿
comments.author: MATSUOKAHIME

comments.text:
OTHER THINGS THAT ANNOYS US:

- You are drawing a nude person or training anatomy and people think that 
you are drawing porn and that you're perv.

- You do something wrong and you're the only one that notices that. 

- When you don't have the right color. That's awful 

I started drawing because my best friend loved drawing. We were 9 at that 
time. I always loved drawing, but she inspired me to get better in that. I 
draw anime, manga, and I am otaku. Another reason why I draw. I draw 
seriously to get better for almost 6 years. ﻿
comments.author: MATSUOKAHIME

comments.author: SparkleFountain

comments.text:
I have something to add. I can't edit it on phone so I'll reply to my 
comment. So anyways, I draw to express my feelings, not draw requests. For 
an example, I draw yuri because my feelings of girls, not because I just 
wanted to.
comments.author: SparkleFountain

comments.text: I totaly get these!﻿
comments.author: Abigail Hidle

comments.text:
It's funny how a lot of people are complaining about the stereotypical 
problems of being an artist (not that I don't experience them but not all) 
cause I draw a LOT. Even my teachers know that. Just this school year 
before I graduated, I always tend to finish exams faster than others 
(except in math), so it had become a habit of mine to have a pencil and 
eraser nearby and doodle on my paper and one time when I got my paper back, 
a teacher wrote 'hey that's nice' on a doodle of a realistic crying eye on 
my exam paper and I was so happy that they weren't mad at me for drawing 
during exams xD﻿
comments.author: Danielle Anne Lacson

comments.text:
The worst is when you let someone have a piece of art and they put their 
name on it/take credit for it﻿
comments.author: Cassie Nelson

comments.text:
I was always known as "the artist" in my school and sometimes I would 
actually draw something, leave the drawing on my desk, leave the room, and 
I would just know that my desk would be surrounded by like five classmates 
looking at it whenever I came back. It was actually the main reason why 
anyone ever paid attention to me, but I am glad my sketches made others 
happy.﻿

they are insane. TT-TT﻿

comments.author: happyzinny

comments.text:
Guys, if you are an artist like me, I am very sure all of us have faced 
these two situations:
When you show your artworks to others:
Most  of the practical people would say: ''Wow, that's nice!'' and nothing 
more than a compliment (Which I DO NOT really like.......)
BUT artistic people would say: ''Wow, that nice!'' then they would start 
asking questions that are relevant to your drawing or giving critiques to 
help you to improve your skills if they are professionals.﻿
comments.author: Kai Hong Chan

comments.text:
Oh my gawddd... This one... jus... *mind explodes*
